description:
NTS Map: 082O11Elevation Gain: 580 m (1,900 ft).Blue Hill Lookout was one of the original sites chosen for a Fire look out site and is still an active lookout.

The trail to the lookout is an old closed fire road.

View from lookout include a number of L/O sites and former L/O sites. Including Limestone Mountain to north, Mockingbird Hill and Black Roack the south. Devils Head and Mt Alymer can be seen to south west, west are valleys of Red Deer and Clearwater rivers.

Foothills and prairies compromise the view in easterly direction.
directions:
Map sheet Burnt Timber Creek 82-O/11

Trailhead: Park near a gate at the start of an unmarked side road on the north side of the road leading toward Sundre off the Forestry Trunk Road (940), 2.3 km east of the Red Deer Ranger station
title: Blue Hill Lookout
